member.name: T:KeePassLib.Utility.UrlUtil
member.summary: A class containing various static path utility helper methods (like stripping extension from a file, etc.).

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Utility.UrlUtil.GetFileDirectory(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the directory (path) of a file name. The returned string may be terminated by a directory separator character. Example: passing C:\\My Documents\\My File.kdb in and true to would produce this string: C:\\My Documents\\.
member.param: Full path of a file.
Append a terminating directory separator character to the returned path.

If true, the returned path is guaranteed to be a valid directory path (for example X:\\ instead of X:, overriding ). This should only be set to true, if the returned path is directly passed to some directory API.
member.returns: Directory of the file.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Utility.UrlUtil.GetFileName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the file name of the specified file (full path). Example: if is C:\\My Documents\\My File.kdb the returned string is My File.kdb.
member.param: Full path of a file.
member.returns: File name of the specified file. The return value is an empty string ("") if the input parameter is null.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Utility.UrlUtil.StripExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Strip the extension of a file.
member.param: Full path of a file with extension.
member.returns: File name without extension.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Utility.UrlUtil.GetExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Get the extension of a file.
member.param: Full path of a file with extension.
member.returns: Extension without prepending dot.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Utility.UrlUtil.EnsureTerminatingSeparator(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Ensure that a path is terminated with a directory separator character.
member.param: Input path.
If true, a slash (/) is appended to the string if it's not terminated already. If false, the default system directory separator character is used.
member.returns: Path having a directory separator as last character.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Utility.UrlUtil.GetHost(System.String)
member.summary: Get the host component of an URL. This method is faster and more fault-tolerant than creating an Uri object and querying its Host property.
member.example: For the input s://u:p@d.tld:p/p?q#f the return value is d.tld.

member.name: F:KeePassLib.Serialization.KdbxFile.FileVersion32
member.summary: File version of files saved by the current KdbxFile class. KeePass 2.07 has version 1.01, 2.08 has 1.02, 2.09 has 2.00, 2.10 has 2.02, 2.11 has 2.04, 2.15 has 3.00, 2.20 has 3.01. member.name: T:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString
member.summary: Represents an in-memory encrypted string. ProtectedString objects are immutable and thread-safe.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.#ctor
member.summary: Construct a new protected string object. Protection is disabled.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Construct a new protected string. The string is initialized to the value supplied in the parameters.
member.param: If this parameter is true, the string will be protected in memory (encrypted). If it is false, the string will be stored as plain-text.
The initial string value.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Construct a new protected string. The string is initialized to the value supplied in the parameters (UTF-8 encoded string).
member.param: If this parameter is true, the string will be protected in memory (encrypted). If it is false, the string will be stored as plain-text.
The initial string value, encoded as UTF-8 byte array. This parameter won't be modified; the caller is responsible for clearing it.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.#ctor(System.Boolean,KeePassLib.Security.XorredBuffer)
member.summary: Construct a new protected string. The string is initialized to the value passed in the XorredBuffer object.
member.param: Enable protection or not.
XorredBuffer object containing the string in UTF-8 representation. The UTF-8 string must not be null-terminated.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.ReadString
member.summary: Convert the protected string to a normal string object. Be careful with this function, the returned string object isn't protected anymore and stored in plain-text in the process memory.
member.returns: Plain-text string. Is never null.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.ReadUtf8
member.summary: Read out the string and return a byte array that contains the string encoded using UTF-8. The returned string is not protected anymore!
member.returns: Plain-text UTF-8 byte array.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.ReadXorredString(KeePassLib.Cryptography.CryptoRandomStream)
member.summary: Read the protected string and return it protected with a sequence of bytes generated by a random stream.
member.param: Random number source.
member.returns: Protected string.

member.name: P:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedString.IsProtected
member.summary: A flag specifying whether the ProtectedString object has turned on memory protection or not.

member.name: T:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedBinary
member.summary: Represents a protected binary, i.e. a byte array that is encrypted in memory. A ProtectedBinary object is immutable and thread-safe.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedBinary.#ctor
member.summary: Construct a new, empty protected binary data object. Protection is disabled.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedBinary.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Construct a new protected binary data object.
member.param: If this paremeter is true, the data will be encrypted in memory. If it is false, the data is stored in plain-text in the process memory.
Value of the protected object. The input parameter is not modified and ProtectedBinary doesn't take ownership of the data, i.e. the caller is responsible for clearing it.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedBinary.#ctor(System.Boolean,KeePassLib.Security.XorredBuffer)
member.summary: Construct a new protected binary data object. Copy the data from a XorredBuffer object.
member.param: Enable protection or not.
XorredBuffer object used to initialize the ProtectedBinary object.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedBinary.ReadData
member.summary: Get a copy of the protected data as a byte array. Please note that the returned byte array is not protected and can therefore been read by any other application. Make sure that your clear it properly after usage.
member.returns: Unprotected byte array. This is always a copy of the internal protected data and can therefore be cleared safely.

member.name: M:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedBinary.ReadXorredData(KeePassLib.Cryptography.CryptoRandomStream)
member.summary: Read the protected data and return it protected with a sequence of bytes generated by a random stream.
member.param: Random number source.

member.name: P:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedBinary.ExtCrypt
member.summary: A plugin can provide a custom memory protection method by assigning a non-null delegate to this property.

member.name: P:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedBinary.IsProtected
member.summary: A flag specifying whether the ProtectedBinary object has turned on memory protection or not.

member.name: P:KeePassLib.Security.ProtectedBinary.Length
member.summary: Length of the stored data.
